title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Kings chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Kings Chapter 22.

questions.question: How old was Josiah when he began to reign in Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: 8 years old
questions.explanation: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, as stated in 2 Kings 22:1.

questions.question: Who was Josiah's mother?
questions.correctAnswer: Jedidah
questions.explanation: Josiah's mother was Jedidah, the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath, according to 2 Kings 22:1.

questions.question: What did Josiah do in the sight of the LORD?
options: Did right and walked in David's ways
questions.correctAnswer: Did right and walked in David's ways
questions.explanation: Josiah did what was right in the sight of the LORD and walked in all the ways of David his father, as stated in 2 Kings 22:2.

questions.question: In the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign, whom did the king send to the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Shaphan the scribe
questions.explanation: The king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, the scribe, to the house of the LORD in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign (2 Kings 22:3).

questions.question: What was Hilkiah the high priest instructed to do by Shaphan?
options: Sum the silver brought into the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Sum the silver brought into the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Hilkiah was told to sum the silver which was brought into the house of the LORD, as recorded in 2 Kings 22:4.

questions.question: What was the money given to the doers of the work used for?
options: Repairing the breaches of the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Repairing the breaches of the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: The money was given to those overseeing the house of the LORD to repair its breaches (2 Kings 22:5).

questions.question: What did Hilkiah the high priest find in the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: The book of the law
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found the book of the law in the house of the LORD and gave it to Shaphan (2 Kings 22:8).

questions.question: What was King Josiah's reaction when he heard the words of the book of the law?
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes
questions.explanation: Upon hearing the book of the law, Josiah rent his clothes as a sign of distress (2 Kings 22:11).

questions.question: Who did the king command to inquire of the LORD concerning the words of the book found?
options: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.correctAnswer: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.explanation: The king commanded these five men to seek the LORD about the book's words (2 Kings 22:12-13).

questions.question: To whom did Hilkiah and the others go to inquire of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Huldah the prophetess
questions.explanation: They went to Huldah the prophetess who dwelt in Jerusalem (2 Kings 22:14).

questions.question: What did Huldah say the LORD would bring upon the place and its inhabitants?
questions.correctAnswer: Evil
questions.explanation: Huldah declared that the LORD would bring evil upon the place and inhabitants as per the book's words (2 Kings 22:16).

questions.question: Why did the LORD's wrath burn against the place and its inhabitants?
options: They forsook God and burned incense to other gods
They built altars only to the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They forsook God and burned incense to other gods
questions.explanation: The wrath was kindled because they forsook the LORD and burned incense to other gods (2 Kings 22:17).

questions.question: True or False: Josiah wept and humbled himself before the LORD when he heard the words of the book of the law.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Josiah humbled himself, rent his clothes, and wept before the LORD after hearing the words of the law (2 Kings 22:19).

questions.question: True or False: The LORD told Josiah he would see all the evil that would come upon the place during his lifetime.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The LORD said Josiah's eyes shall not see all the evil brought upon the place, and he would be gathered in peace (2 Kings 22:20).

questions.question: True or False: No reckoning was made with the workers for the money delivered because they dealt faithfully.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: No reckoning was made because the workers dealt faithfully with the money (2 Kings 22:7).

medium.title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Kings Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Kings 22 teach us about integrity in work and stewardship?
options: By faithfully handling resources without mismanagement
By ignoring the needs of the temple repairs
By secretly keeping the money for personal gain
By delaying the repairs to avoid work
questions.correctAnswer: By faithfully handling resources without mismanagement
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Kings 22:7 explains that those who handled the money did so faithfully and no accounting was made against them, demonstrating honesty and integrity in stewardship. This teaches the importance of faithfulness and trustworthiness in managing resources.

questions.question: What spiritual discipline is demonstrated by King Josiah when he heard the words of the book of the law?
options: He humbled himself and showed repentance
He ignored the message and continued as before
questions.correctAnswer: He humbled himself and showed repentance
questions.explanation: According to 2 Kings 22:11, the king rent his clothes upon hearing the law, a sign of humility and repentance. This shows the importance of responding with a humble heart and contrition when confronted with God's Word.

questions.question: Based on 2 Kings 22, what should we do when we discover sin or wrongdoing in our lives or community?
options: Seek the Lord in prayer for guidance and mercy
Ignore it and hope it goes away
Take immediate harsh action without seeking God
questions.correctAnswer: Seek the Lord in prayer for guidance and mercy
questions.explanation: In 2 Kings 22:13-14, Josiah sent people to inquire of the Lord through the prophetess Huldah about the words found. This shows the importance of prayerful seeking of God's guidance and mercy when facing sin.

questions.question: How does Josiah’s response to the book of the law model godly leadership for family and community?
options: He humbly acknowledges sin and seeks God’s direction
He ignores the problem and focuses on political power
He blames others for past sins
He refuses to listen to the priests and prophets
questions.correctAnswer: He humbly acknowledges sin and seeks God’s direction
questions.explanation: Josiah's humility and willingness to seek God’s will (2 Kings 22:11-13, 19) demonstrate how godly leaders should lead by example in recognizing sin and pursuing repentance and guidance.

questions.question: What does the discovery of the book of the law in the temple emphasize about the importance of Scripture in daily life?
options: The centrality of God’s Word in guiding obedience and reform
That the law was outdated and ignored
That external rituals matter more than Scripture
That only priests need to know the law
questions.correctAnswer: The centrality of God’s Word in guiding obedience and reform
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found the book of the law (2 Kings 22:8), which led to true repentance and reforms, showing that Scripture is essential for guiding godly living and obedience.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear about God's judgment. Based on 2 Kings 22, what encouragement can you offer?
options: God hears the humble and grants peace to the repentant
There is no hope once judgment is declared
questions.correctAnswer: God hears the humble and grants peace to the repentant
questions.explanation: Huldah’s prophecy in 2 Kings 22:19-20 shows that because Josiah humbled himself and wept, God promised peace in his days, revealing God’s mercy toward the humble and repentant.

questions.question: How does the passage instruct us to respond when confronted with the reality of sin in our lives?
options: With humility, repentance, and seeking God’s forgiveness
By hiding the issue and ignoring it
questions.correctAnswer: With humility, repentance, and seeking God’s forgiveness
questions.explanation: Josiah’s reaction to the law (2 Kings 22:11) and his seeking of the LORD’s guidance (2 Kings 22:13) teach that the proper response to sin is humble repentance and prayer.

questions.question: How is the virtue of stewardship modeled in the repair of the temple described in 2 Kings 22?
options: Careful allocation and honest use of resources for God’s work
Neglecting the temple and wasting money
Using temple funds for personal benefit
questions.correctAnswer: Careful allocation and honest use of resources for God’s work
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Kings 22:4-7 describe how the silver was gathered and given to workers to repair the temple, with faithful handling and no need for accounting, illustrating godly stewardship.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah began his reign at the age of 8 and continued to reign for 31 years, demonstrating perseverance in faith and leadership.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:1 states Josiah began to reign at 8 years old and reigned 31 years, showing long-term commitment and perseverance in leading according to God’s ways.

questions.question: True or False: The prophetess Huldah assured the delegation that no judgment would come upon the land despite the people's sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Huldah warned that judgment would come because of the people’s sin (2 Kings 22:16-17), but also gave hope for Josiah personally (2 Kings 22:19-20).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Josiah's heart was ______ and he humbled himself before the LORD when he heard the words of the book of the law.
questions.correctAnswer: tender
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:19 describes Josiah’s heart as tender and his humility before the LORD, showing the importance of a soft, repentant heart in responding to God’s Word.

questions.question: What does Shaphan’s role in reading the book to the king teach about the importance of sharing God’s Word in the community?
options: It is vital to openly read and communicate Scripture to leaders and others
God’s Word should be kept secret
Only priests should hear the Word
questions.correctAnswer: It is vital to openly read and communicate Scripture to leaders and others
questions.explanation: Shaphan read the book of the law to King Josiah (2 Kings 22:10), demonstrating the importance of making God’s Word accessible and impactful for spiritual renewal.

questions.question: How does 2 Kings 22 model seeking godly counsel when facing spiritual challenges?
options: Josiah sent trusted leaders to inquire of the prophetess Huldah
Josiah ignored the issue and ruled by himself
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah sent trusted leaders to inquire of the prophetess Huldah
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Kings 22:12-14 show Josiah commissioning multiple trusted men to seek the LORD’s word through Huldah, highlighting the value of godly counsel and prayerful decision-making.

questions.question: What does the king’s tearing of his clothes symbolize in biblical humility and repentance?
options: Deep sorrow and recognition of sin before God
questions.correctAnswer: Deep sorrow and recognition of sin before God
questions.explanation: Tearing clothes was a biblical sign of mourning and repentance (2 Kings 22:11), symbolizing a humble heart acknowledging God’s holiness and our need for forgiveness.

questions.question: According to 2 Kings 22, what is the relationship between obedience to God's Word and experiencing His blessing or judgment?
options: Obedience leads to blessing while disobedience brings judgment
Obedience is optional and has no consequences
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience leads to blessing while disobedience brings judgment
questions.explanation: Huldah’s prophecy (2 Kings 22:16-19) clearly connects the people’s disobedience with coming judgment, but Josiah’s humility and obedience bring him peace, illustrating this biblical principle.

hard.title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Kings Chapter 22.

questions.question: At what age did Josiah begin his reign over Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: 8 years old
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:1 states that Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, highlighting the youthfulness of this king at the start of his rule.

questions.question: How did Josiah's conduct compare with that of his ancestor David?
options: He walked in all the ways of David and did right in the eyes of the LORD
He abandoned David's ways and did evil
He partially followed David's ways but often sinned
He was indifferent to the laws of David
questions.correctAnswer: He walked in all the ways of David and did right in the eyes of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 2 emphasizes Josiah's faithful adherence to David's example, showing his righteousness and devotion.

questions.question: Who was sent by King Josiah to oversee the collection and allocation of silver for the temple repairs?
questions.correctAnswer: Shaphan the son of Azaliah
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:3 shows Josiah sending Shaphan, the scribe, to manage the temple treasury and repair work, linking royal authority with temple administration.

questions.question: What was the purpose of collecting silver and giving it to carpenters, builders, and masons?
options: To repair the breaches in the house of the LORD
To fund the king’s military campaigns
To buy sacrifices for the temple
questions.correctAnswer: To repair the breaches in the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verses 5-6 clarify that the money was specifically designated for restoring the temple, emphasizing the importance of temple purity and maintenance.

questions.question: Why was there no accounting made for the money delivered to the temple workers?
options: Because the king trusted the priests blindly
Because the work was not completed
questions.correctAnswer: Because they dealt faithfully
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:7 highlights the integrity of the workers, indicating a trustworthy stewardship of temple funds, which was crucial in the ancient Near Eastern context.

questions.question: What significant discovery did Hilkiah the high priest make in the house of the LORD?
options: Ancient relics of the past kings
questions.correctAnswer: The book of the law
questions.explanation: Verse 8 records the discovery of the 'book of the law,' a critical textual find that foreshadows Josiah’s religious reforms and links to Deuteronomic traditions.

questions.question: What was King Josiah’s reaction upon hearing the words of the book of the law?
options: He ordered immediate destruction of idols
questions.correctAnswer: He rent (tore) his clothes
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:11 shows Josiah’s profound emotional and religious response, a traditional sign of mourning and repentance in Hebrew culture.

questions.question: Who were sent by Josiah to enquire of the LORD about the words found in the book?
options: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.correctAnswer: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 describe this delegation, demonstrating a formal, priestly inquiry into divine judgment consistent with prophetic and Deuteronomic traditions.

questions.question: To whom did the delegation go to seek prophecy about the book of the law?
questions.correctAnswer: Huldah the prophetess
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:14 introduces Huldah, a rare female prophet in the Hebrew Bible, highlighting the prophetic role in delivering God’s message.

questions.question: What was the essence of Huldah’s prophecy regarding the fate of Jerusalem?
options: Evil would come upon the place because of forsaking God
The city would be destroyed immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Evil would come upon the place because of forsaking God
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 describe divine judgment because the people had forsaken God and worshipped other gods, a thematic fulfillment of covenant curses found in Deuteronomy.

questions.question: Why was Josiah promised peace at his death despite the coming judgment?
options: Because his heart was tender and he humbled himself before the LORD
Because he was a powerful king
Because he made alliances with foreign nations
Because he ignored the book of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Because his heart was tender and he humbled himself before the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:19 reveals that Josiah’s humility and repentance earned him a peaceful death, illustrating the biblical principle of individual responsibility and mercy.

questions.question: What does Josiah tearing his clothes symbolize in the ancient Hebrew context?
questions.correctAnswer: Mourning and repentance
questions.explanation: Tearing of clothes, as seen in 2 Kings 22:11 and elsewhere in the Hebrew Bible, is a traditional expression of grief and turning back to God.

questions.question: Which theme prominent in Deuteronomy is reflected in the discovery and response to the book of the law in 2 Kings 22?
options: Covenant fidelity and consequences for disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: Covenant fidelity and consequences for disobedience
questions.explanation: The chapter’s emphasis on the law book and resulting judgment recalls Deuteronomy’s covenant theology, where obedience leads to blessing and disobedience to curse.

questions.question: True or False: The prophetess Huldah resided outside Jerusalem in a rural area.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 22:14 specifies that Huldah dwelt in Jerusalem, in the college, indicating her central role in the religious community.

questions.question: What role did Shaphan play in the events of 2 Kings 22?
options: He was the scribe who read the book of the law to the king
He was the high priest who found the book
He was the prophet who warned the people
questions.correctAnswer: He was the scribe who read the book of the law to the king
questions.explanation: Verses 8 and 10 depict Shaphan as the scribe who not only managed finances but also read the discovered law book to Josiah, emphasizing his administrative and literary role.

theological.title: 2 Kings Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Kings Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: At what age did Josiah begin to reign as king of Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Eight years old
questions.explanation: Josiah began to reign at eight years old, demonstrating God's use of a young king to lead a spiritual revival (2 Kings 22:1). This reflects God's sovereignty in raising leaders early (1 Samuel 16:13; Jeremiah 1:7; Luke 2:52).

questions.question: How did Josiah conduct himself during his reign according to 2 Kings 22?
options: He did right in the sight of the LORD
He followed the practices of surrounding nations
He was indifferent to God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: He did right in the sight of the LORD
questions.explanation: Josiah walked in the ways of David and did not turn aside, showing obedience and faithfulness to God (2 Kings 22:2). This aligns with God's desire for obedience (Deuteronomy 6:5; Psalm 119:1; John 14:15; Hebrews 11:6).

questions.question: In Josiah's eighteenth year, whom did he send to the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Shaphan the scribe
questions.explanation: Josiah sent Shaphan the scribe to oversee the temple repairs and inquiry, highlighting the role of faithful servants in spiritual renewal (2 Kings 22:3-4). This is consistent with biblical themes of godly leadership (Exodus 24:12; Nehemiah 8:7; Acts 6:3; 2 Timothy 3:16).

questions.question: What was the purpose of gathering silver in the house of the LORD during Josiah's reign?
options: To repair the breaches of the house
questions.correctAnswer: To repair the breaches of the house
questions.explanation: The silver was gathered to repair the temple, reflecting God's concern for holiness and the place of worship (2 Kings 22:4-6). This is paralleled in the building of the tabernacle and temple in Exodus 25:1-9, Nehemiah 2:8, Psalm 122:1, and John 2:19-21.

questions.question: What significant discovery did Hilkiah the high priest make during the temple repairs?
questions.correctAnswer: The book of the law
questions.explanation: Hilkiah found the book of the law, a pivotal moment showing God's word as the foundation for covenant renewal (2 Kings 22:8). This underscores the centrality of Scripture (Deuteronomy 31:24-26; Ezra 7:6; Isaiah 40:8; 2 Timothy 3:16).

questions.question: How did King Josiah react when he heard the words of the book of the law?
questions.correctAnswer: He rent his clothes
questions.explanation: Josiah rent his clothes in repentance and grief upon hearing the law, demonstrating godly sorrow and humility (2 Kings 22:11). This aligns with biblical examples of repentance (Genesis 37:29; Joel 2:13; Luke 19:41-42; James 4:8).

questions.question: Who did Josiah command to inquire of the LORD concerning the words of the book found?
options: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.correctAnswer: Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asahiah
questions.explanation: Josiah sent a trusted delegation to seek the LORD's guidance, showing reliance on prophetic insight (2 Kings 22:12-13). This reflects biblical patterns of seeking God's counsel through appointed representatives (Numbers 27:21; 1 Samuel 9:9; Jeremiah 1:7; Acts 13:2).

questions.question: To whom did the delegation go to inquire of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Huldah the prophetess
questions.explanation: The delegation consulted Huldah, affirming the role of the Spirit-inspired prophetess in revealing God's word (2 Kings 22:14-15). This corresponds with the biblical role of prophets (Deuteronomy 18:18-22; 1 Samuel 9:9; Acts 21:10-11; Revelation 19:10).

questions.question: What did Huldah prophesy concerning the words of the book that Josiah had read?
options: Evil would come upon the land because of forsaking God
Peace and blessing would come immediately
The king would build a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: Evil would come upon the land because of forsaking God
questions.explanation: Huldah warned of coming judgment due to Israel's idolatry, emphasizing God's righteousness and justice (2 Kings 22:16-17). This aligns with biblical themes of divine judgment for sin (Deuteronomy 28:15; Isaiah 1:18-20; Romans 1:18; Hebrews 10:26-31).

questions.question: According to Huldah, why would God's wrath be kindled against the place and its inhabitants?
options: Because they have forsaken Him and burned incense to other gods
Because they neglected the temple repairs
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have forsaken Him and burned incense to other gods
questions.explanation: The people's idolatry provoked God's anger, illustrating the seriousness of covenant unfaithfulness (2 Kings 22:17). This is consistent with the biblical condemnation of idolatry (Exodus 20:3-5; Psalm 115:4-8; Jeremiah 10:10; 1 Corinthians 10:14).

questions.question: What did the LORD say He would do to Josiah because his heart was tender and humbled?
options: Gather him to his grave in peace, sparing him from seeing the coming evil
Make him king over all Israel
Grant him great wealth and long life
Allow him to build a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: Gather him to his grave in peace, sparing him from seeing the coming evil
questions.explanation: God promised Josiah peaceful death, showing divine mercy to those who repent and humble themselves (2 Kings 22:19-20). This reflects God's grace in judgment (Psalm 34:18; Isaiah 57:1-2; Matthew 5:4; Romans 2:4).

questions.question: Who was the mother of King Josiah?
options: Jedidah, daughter of Adaiah of Boscath
questions.correctAnswer: Jedidah, daughter of Adaiah of Boscath
questions.explanation: Josiah's mother was Jedidah, indicating the lineage and family background which often influenced a king's reign (2 Kings 22:1). This connects to biblical genealogies emphasizing God's providence (Matthew 1:6-16; Luke 3:23-38; 1 Chronicles 3:10-15; Ruth 4:18-22).

questions.question: What was the attitude of the workers who repaired the temple regarding the money given to them?
options: They dealt faithfully and made no reckoning
They refused to work without more money
questions.correctAnswer: They dealt faithfully and made no reckoning
questions.explanation: The workers trusted and acted with integrity, showing godly stewardship and faithfulness (2 Kings 22:7). This reflects biblical principles of honesty and diligence (Proverbs 12:22; Colossians 3:23; 2 Corinthians 8:21; Luke 16:10).

questions.question: What was the response of the king’s servants after collecting the money for the temple repairs?
options: They delivered it into the hand of the doers of the work
They used it for personal expenses
They hid it to keep it safe
They gave it to the priests for offerings
questions.correctAnswer: They delivered it into the hand of the doers of the work
questions.explanation: The servants responsibly managed and delivered the funds to those overseeing repairs, demonstrating order and accountability (2 Kings 22:9). This is consistent with biblical teachings on stewardship (Exodus 36:3-7; Nehemiah 5:16; Luke 12:42-44; 1 Peter 4:10).

questions.question: What does the discovery of the book of the law during Josiah's reign teach about the role of Scripture in covenant renewal?
options: It is foundational for repentance and reform
It is merely historical and not applicable
It caused division among the people
It was ignored by the king
questions.correctAnswer: It is foundational for repentance and reform
questions.explanation: The book's discovery led to repentance and covenant renewal, highlighting Scripture's role in revealing sin and guiding obedience (2 Kings 22:8-13). This theme is echoed in Ezra 7:10, Nehemiah 8:1-8, Romans 15:4, and Hebrews 4:12.
